meanings.definition: A region in northern Europe, comprising Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and sometimes Finland.
meanings.sent1: In the past, explorers traveled to scandia to discover new lands.
meanings.sent2: My friend is planning a trip to scandia to explore the beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent3: The scandia region is known for its stunning fjords and picturesque villages.
meanings.sent4: Her dream vacation would be a journey through the enchanting lands of scandia.
meanings.sent5: The folklore of scandia is filled with tales of brave warriors and mystical creatures.

meanings.definition: A rare earth element, also known as scandium oxide.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying scandia to understand its unique properties.
meanings.sent2: The new technology uses scandia to enhance the performance of electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: When the professor mentioned scandia in class, everyone's eyes widened with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The value of scandia in the industry is increasing due to its versatility.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of scandia opened up new possibilities for advanced materials.

meanings.definition: A type of ceramic material used in the production of high-performance cutting tools.
meanings.sent1: The engineers tested the durability of scandia in the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: The company invested in scandia to improve the quality of their products.
meanings.sent3: The scandia material proved to be a game-changer in the tool industry.
meanings.sent4: Using scandia in the tools made them sharper and more efficient.
meanings.sent5: The workshop buzzed with excitement as the new batch of scandia tools arrived.
